senses.sense_definition: Of or relating to the mastoid process, the bony projection of the temporal bone located behind the ear.

examples.text: The doctor examined the <w>mastoid</w> region for any signs of swelling or tenderness.
Chronic ear infections can sometimes spread to the <w>mastoid</w> bone cells.
The biologist identified the species by its distinct <w>mastoid</w> shape.
Under the microscope, the spores appeared tetrahedral and <w>mastoid</w>.

senses.sense_definition: The bony prominence located behind the ear; a short form of <w>mastoid process</w>.

examples.text: The surgeon needed to operate on the <w>mastoid</w> to clear the infection.
He felt a sharp pain radiating from his <w>mastoid</w>.

senses.sense_definition: An inflammation of the bone behind the ear; a short form of <w>mastoiditis</w>.

examples.text: The patient was diagnosed with a <w>mastoid</w> after complaining of severe ear pain.
Antibiotics are typically used to treat a <w>mastoid</w> before surgery is considered.
